Description

Founded in Tokyo in 2012, SmartNews has quickly become the go-to source of news for millions of users around the world, and a leading news discovery mobile app in Japan and the US. Our mission is bigger than simply aggregating news, and we are working to break through the filter bubble and deliver the world’s quality information to the people who need it.

SmartNews is seeking strong AI/Machine Learning interns to work on US news ranking projects. The team pursues research & development in the areas of applied machine learning, with focus on deep neural networks, large-scale recommendation systems, NLP and reinforcement learning etc. As a member of the team, you will work with experienced ML engineers and AI researchers on some of the most challenging technical problems, develop new ML solutions that will impact user experience, and collaborate with the best product teams to integrate your ideas into our products.


Requirements

• In-depth expertise in deep learning and recommendation

• Excellent programming skills in Java, Python, Sql, C/C++

• Strong publication record and good communication skills

• Knowledge of common ML frameworks such as TensorFlow and/or PyTorch

• Creative, collaborative, & product-focused

• Expected to perform well in a fast-paced environment


Education & Experience

Pursuing PhD, Masters degree in AI/Machine Learning, Natural Language Processing, Computer Science, Data Science, or related areas.

Benefits

Due to the covid-19 situation, the intern can choose to work remotely from your own place.

Apply for this job

Noblis is seeking qualified technical interns for spring 2021.

 

Guided and mentored by our expert staff (including former interns), Noblis interns augment their classroom learning with hands-on project work in: 

  • Machine Learning
  • Artificial Intelligence
  • Data Analytics  
  • Computer Science
  • Autonomous Systems
  • Life and Chemical/Biological Sciences

Your contributions will make an enduring impact supporting our Noblis Sponsored Research Program. The NSR program is a vital and essential part of corporate life at Noblis. Our yearly investment in this program, along with our ethical practices and code of conduct, is part of what makes us the unique nonprofit organization that we are. Noblis research is the forward-thinking seed that generates not only larger corporate work programs and roles, but also sound, sustainable solutions with enduring impacts. 

 

Our NSR projects demonstrate the art of the possible to our clients. They enable us to create new intellectual capital and capabilities and to develop new thinking and models that will help us solve critical problems that our clients will face in the future. Noblis research allows us to expand staff capabilities and provides an interesting outlet for the creative and inventive spirit found throughout Noblis. 

 

Noblis is consistently recognized as a “Great Place to Work” and “One of the Best Mid-Sized Companies to Work For" by Glassdoor, Entrepreneur and The Great Place to Work Institute. Noblis was recognized as the top ranked government contractor on the Washington Post's Top Workplaces listing, for the seventh year in a row.



What you bring to the table:

  • Proof of U.S. citizenship or permanent residency; 
  • A GPA of 3.3 or higher in your undergraduate, graduate or doctoral studies;
  • Demonstrated analytical skills, strong written and oral communication skills and team work skills.
  • Availability to work part-time supporting some of the market’s leading-edge technologies

 

Fall and Winter interns can be eligible to participate in our 2021 summer internship following their completion of the fall program.


Noblis and our wholly owned subsidiary, Noblis ESI, tackle the nation's toughest problems and apply advanced solutions to our clients' most critical missions. We bring the best of scientific thought, management and engineering expertise together in an environment of independence and objectivity to deliver enduring impact on federal missions. Noblis works with a wide range of government clients in the defense, intelligence and federal civil sectors. Learn more at Noblis -About Us

 

Why work at a Noblis company?

Our employees find greater meaning in their work and balance the other things in life that matter to them. Our people are our greatest asset. They are exceptionally skilled, knowledgeable, team-oriented, and mission-driven individuals who want to do work that matters and benefits the public. Noblis has won numerous workplace awards. Noblis maintains a drug-free workplace.

 

Noblis is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Employment decisions are made without regard to race (as well as because of or on the basis of traits historically associated with race, including hair texture, hair type, and protective hairstyles such as braids, locks, and twists), color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, physical or mental disability, pregnancy, childbirth, lactation and related medical conditions, genetic factors, military/veteran status, or other characteristics protected by law.

Description

Texas Instruments Incorporated (TI) is a global semiconductor design and manufacturing company that develops analog ICs and embedded processors. By employing the world’s brightest minds, TI creates innovations that shape the future of technology. TI is helping more than 100,000 customers transform the future, today. We’re committed to building a better future – from the responsible manufacturing of our semiconductors, to caring for our employees, to giving back inside our communities and developing great minds.

About the Job

TI fosters a culture of innovation and flawless execution built on a robust manufacturing strategy, a broad sales channel and a superior customer design experience through TI.com that creates demand for our products. IT Services (ITS) plays a critical role in these areas by providing the important resources, tools and services that can improve the company’s execution.

IT Services provides the infrastructure that will drive business growth, agility, innovation, process excellence, customer experience & global reach for TI. IT Services is strategically positioned to be the engine for TI’s growth. The organization supports TI’s applications and technology infrastructure for the company’s critical design, sales, manufacturing, finance, operations and security functions.

When you join the IT Service organization, you will broaden your perspective and learn the IT organizations and cultures, and build a strong network and develop cross functional skills. You will gain exposure to the variety of IT roles by having meaningful assignments from the start- because nothing beats real-world experience.

Put your talent to work with Texas Instruments – change the world, love your job!

Mainframe Application Developer:

Application developers design, code, and deploy new applications and enhancements that solve TI business needs. They work in a variety of spaces including Mainframe, web development, manufacturing automation, and data analytics.

+ Collaborate with project team members and stakeholders to translate business requirements into documented technical specifications, architecture and requirements

+ Supporting the requirements, design, software development, testing, and implementation phases for TI’s Mainframe applications

+ Use a variety of programming languages, scripting languages, and middleware tools such as Cobol, Oracle, JCL, Focus, C, IBM z/OS, IBM DB, DB2, TSO/ISPF, MQ, SQL, Unix/Linux and scripting

+ Monitor and support existing applications across operating systems including Mainframe, Windows and Unix/Linux

+ Create and execute unit testing and integration testing plans. Support user acceptance testing

+ Partner with the IT infrastructure and security teams to harden and secure the application environments

Mainframe System Programmer/Administrator:

+ Consulting with business application owners to understand their requirements in order to design and implement the best infrastructure solutions to meet their needs

+ Researching and provisioning new technology solutions to meet the demands of our business application owners.

+ Provision, test and support TI’s Mainframe Applications/Utilities and make needed enhancements to IBM products via user exits and In-line mods.

+ Monitoring performance and capacity of TI’s Mainframe Environment

+ Mainframe systems provisioning/support using Assembler and REXX programming languages, JCL, TSO, ISPF

+ Provision and test mainframe network software and hardware

Texas Instruments will not sponsor job applicants for visas or work authorization for this position.

Qualifications

Minimum Requirements:

* Currently pursuing a degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Information Systems or a related field

* Minimum cumulative 3.0 GPA

* Basic understanding of programming (Assembler, REXX, Perl, Python, SQL)

* Basic understanding of Mainframe systems programming

Preferred Qualifications:

* Demonstrated analytical and problem solving skills

* Strong verbal and written communication skills

* Ability to work in teams and collaborate effectively with people in different functions

* Strong time management skills that enable on-time project delivery

* Ability to build strong, influential relationships

* Ability to work effectively in a fast-paced and rapidly changing environment

* Ability to take the initiative and drive for results

* Strong customer service skills

* Demonstrated ability to handle multiple priorities

* Ability to handle ambiguity

* Ability to comprehend complex technical challenges

If you are interested in this position, please apply to this requisition.

Texas Instruments is an equal opportunity employer and supports a diverse, inclusive work environment. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to protected characteristics, including race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or age.

Federal Reserve Bank of Dallas

 TX-Dallas

 Full-time

 Non-exempt

 Internship

Travel

Shift

 Day Job
Work Hours M-F, 8:00am-5:00pm, with flexibility
Job Sensitivity Tier II - No Credit Check

ABOUT THE ROLE:

We are looking for a talented and highly-motivated Technology Risk Intern to join the Banking Supervision Department for the 2021 – 2022 academic year. The candidate will gain valuable experience supporting Supervisory Risk and Surveillance programs and contribute to IT assessments and examinations of financial institutions (FIs) and service providers (SPs).

ABOUT THE INTERNSHIP PROGRAM:

We offer paid internships for many majors, with fulfilling work and opportunities to grow. To help launch your career, we provide dedicated staff mentors. You’ll also learn from senior leaders and industry experts. As part of the Federal Reserve System, you’ll be connected to a professional network that spans the nation. You will be based in the Dallas office and available to begin in summer 2021.

ABOUT THE TEAM:

The Technology Risk team is part of the Banking Supervision Department and conducts IT assessments and examinations of FIs and SPs under Reserve Bank supervisory authority, with the overall goal of protecting the nation’s financial system.

YOU WILL:

  • Conduct research and prepare reports on bank technology, digital payments, and cybersecurity emerging risks.
  • Assist in conducting IT, payments, and cybersecurity examinations of banks and/or service providers.
  • Review bank or service provider examination reports.
  • Participate in supervisory and risk meetings and related organizational functions.
  • Work with department management on special projects and other time-sensitive assignments.

YOU WILL BRING:

  • Strong analytical and communication skills, both verbal and written
  • Excellent interpersonal skills and the ability to effectively work in groups
  • Good working knowledge of technology concepts and risk
  • Proficient in software for documenting, organizing information, delivering presentations and processing data
  • Exposure to audit, banking, or cybersecurity industry is preferable but not required
  • Programming skills are preferable but not required
  • Student must be pursuing a graduate degree in Finance, Information Systems, Computer Science, Cybersecurity or a related field with a GPA of 3.0 or better
  • Equivalent education and/or experience may be substituted for any of the above requirements

OUR VIRTUAL BENEFITS:

  • Flexible location and hours
  • Free LinkedIn Learning account
  • Professional development opportunities 
  • One-on-one Senior Management engagement across District

Job Description:

At Leidos we build artificial intelligence and autonomous systems (AI/AS) that perceive, learn, decide and act on their own, for a wide variety of customers including the Defense Advanced Research Projects Agency (DARPA) and the Air Force Research Laboratory (AFRL). However, the inability of these systems to explain their processes, decisions and actions to human users severely limits their effectiveness. Recently, the National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST) began the task of facilitating researcher and practitioner discussions on automation transparency using four principles of explainable AI: Explanation, Meaningfulness, explanation accuracy, and knowledge limits. Leidos, is interested in developing actionable strategies and tools to build transparent and explainable systems essential if users are to understand, appropriately trust, and effectively manage emerging AI/AS.




The Data Science & Engineering team at Leidos is looking for a talented individual to intern this summer in our Arlington, VA office (or virtually, depending on COVID restrictions) to work as part of a multi-disciplinary team of scientists to explore the development and incorporation of explainable AI/AS in applied domains. This is an exciting opportunity to apply your academic knowledge to real-world strategic company initiatives. The internship will offer an opportunity for the successful candidate to work with leading Leidos practitioners and team members in computer, data, and behavioral science to develop strategies that build human trust and understanding into our AI/AS and participate in other data science /developer/psychology based projects. Applicant should be available in May 2021.




Primary Responsibilities

+ Work as part of a team of Leidos computer/data/behaviors scientists to explore the development and incorporation of explainable AI/AS in applied domains.

+ Tasking by project team as needed






Basic Qualifications

+ Currently pursuing an undergraduate education in Computer Science, Data Science, Systems Engineering, Behavior Science, Ethics or related field, with at least 2+ years completed. Maintain a minimum 3.0 cumulative GPA (on a 4.0 scale).

+ Ability to obtain DoD security clearance- US Citizenship required.

+ Demonstrated knowledge of basic artificial intelligence methods: neural networks, reinforcement learning, deep learning, etc. with demonstrated uses in coursework (term projects) or capstone projects.

+ Understanding of the fundamental principles of ethics and the NIST proposed principles and categories for explainable AI.

+ Must be detail-oriented, have excellent organizational skills, and the ability to work with minimal supervision

+ Must have strong written and verbal communication skills






Preferred Qualifications

+ Pursuing Graduate degree

+ Desire to continue working with Leidos on a part-time basis during the school year





External Referral Bonus:Ineligible


Potential for Telework:No


Clearance Level Required:None


Travel:Yes, 10% of the time


Scheduled Weekly Hours:40


Shift:Day

Teradata helps businesses unlock value by turning data into their greatest asset. We’re the cloud data analytics platform company, built for a hybrid multi-cloud reality, solving the world's most complex data challenges at scale. Collectively, we endeavor to serve equal parts innovator and contributor. Because our mission isn’t just about the collection of data – it’s about revolutionizing the future of transportation to save lives, optimizing energy costs to make the planet a cleaner place, and using data to predict and identify cancer risks.


Our Company


Teradata, the world’s largest company solely focused on enterprise data warehousing and analytic solutions, provides powerful solutions for companies of all sizes. Through innovation, consulting services, technology, and industry-specific applications, our customers are outpacing their competition with enterprise agility. It's no secret our people make Teradata great. The world’s business leaders have trusted Teradata for decades as the key to their competitive edge with business intelligence. Why? Because we provide them the agility to adapt and move with confidence – just like we do. We are more than 10,000 passionate professionals in more than 42 countries and we are relentless in our pursuit of excellence.


Our Team


The Teradata Service Analytics team is dedicated to automating customer support and transforming customer support from reactive to proactive by leveraging data and analytics. Our vision is to optimize customers' Teradata solution performance and availability, through automated analytics-driven predictive/proactive issue resolution while enabling Customer self-service. Specifically, to develop an analytics software system for customer support, which will:


+ Utilize data and analytics to predict Customer operational issues

+ Proactively provide solutions to avoid impact to Customer operations

+ Enable Customers to quickly and easily resolve their own problems

+ Assist Customer Support Associates to quickly resolve customer issues


What You'll Do


You will work with data scientists on our team to develop tools to parse text data and extract information from it. The data in question may consist of computer generated logs or natural language work notes. The techniques used may include automated log parsing, natural language processing (NLP), named entity recognition, relation extraction, event extraction, part of speech tagging, sequence modeling, or text clustering. You will have some room to tailor your project to your interests, but the objective is to help automated systems understand and utilize text data, which will in turn make our customer support processes more automated and efficient. You will also collaborate with business analysts, software engineers, product owners, and support engineers to ensure your work provides concrete business value.


Your Background


+ Pursuing a bachelor's degree or higher in data science or machine learning, or in a related field (like statistics or computer science) with coursework in these areas

+ Experience (possibly from coursework) in working with large data sets, data manipulation, data cleaning, exploratory data analysis (EDA), data visualization, and data modeling

+ Experience with text data, natural language data, or natural language processing (NLP) preferred

+ Programming experience, preferably in Python and SQL

+ Excellent verbal and written communication skills

+ Ability to collaborate on an interdisciplinary team to solve problems in a fast-paced environment

+ Self-starter with a positive attitude, intellectual curiosity, and a passion for analytics and solving real world problems.


Teradata invites all identities and backgrounds in the workplace. position: Precision Solutions Product Validation Field Test Engineer Intern
description:
Through its people and brands, CNH Industrial delivers power, technology and innovation to farmers, builders and drivers all around the world. Each of its brands, including Case IH, New Holland Agriculture, Case and New Holland Construction, FPT Industrial, Capital, and Aftermarket Solutions, is a major international force in its specific sector.

 

The Precision Solutions Product Validation Field Test Engineer will experience in full life cycle of SW design process and life cycle; Hands-on experience in dynamic complex HW/SW testing environment. This intern will also be apart of development of test plans, test cases, and methodology in a production environment, as well as, troubleshooting CAN-based vehicle electronic systems.


  • Develop and/or maintain detailed system and sub-system test procedures for functional, performance, and safety tests as related to Precision Farming, Product Control, and Guidance content based on system specifications.
  • Execute validation plan and test procedures on the bench or in-field testing at CNH Industrial test facilities or external customer sites.
  • Document and clearly communicate test results, including issue reporting into proper tracking tools. Maintain and update issues as they are resolved.
  • Assist in root cause analysis and validation of resolution for problems identified during field testing. Collect and analyze data to assist development team in root cause identification and problem resolution.
  • Submit timely and concise reports covering system performance.
  • Aid design team in vehicle tuning exercises or targeted development tests for Auto Guidance and Precision Farming features of the PS&T software.

•Pursuing Bachelor’s Degree in Agricultural, Mechanical, Electrical Engineering, computer science or EET or related degree area.

 

Preferred Qualifications

 

• Experience with Farm Equipment, Precision Farming systems or connected vehicle systems.
• Experience in electronic troubleshooting and diagnostics or a related field. Complex mechanical assembly service or troubleshooting acceptable too.
• Experience with development and execution of test plans.
• Ability to demonstrate good written and verbal communication skills required.
• Ability to demonstrate good computer skills with Word, Excel, MSOffice suite.
• Ability to work independently with little supervision.

• Closed loop control system appreciation and understanding – electro-hydraulic, electrical and electronic systems.
• Mechanical aptitude and appreciation, to supplement, if SW and/or Electrical background
• Communications protocol experience and understanding (e.g. Serial, CAN, Cellular, Wifi, GPS, ISOBUS).
• Agricultural, construction, or similar background which demonstrates familiarity with operation of off-highway equipment.
• Experience using Vector tools, or other tools for serial bus system data logging and analysis.

Overview

Why Consider JAGGAER? 

 

JAGGAER is the world's leading provider of comprehensive source-to-pay solutions. Some of the largest commercial, manufacturing and life sciences companies and government organizations in the world trust JAGGAER with billions of dollars of annual spend. JAGGAER eProcurement and strategic sourcing customers across the globe have gained access to the best suppliers, with the best terms, on our scalable, customizable, user-friendly platform. Our SaaS-based, source-to-settle solution provides unparalleled visibility, insights and recommendations to procurement leaders and suppliers. The result is a fluid supply chain driven by powerful spend analysis, comprehensive contract management and efficient accounts payable solutions.

 

What We’re Looking For:

 

We are seeking a Quality Assurance (QA) intern to learn with our QA team and perform functional testing on our state-of-the-art procurement software service. Along with performing functional testing, you may have the opportunity to learn the basis of automation techniques and scripting, and perhaps complete discrete assignments with the automation team.

Functional testing is a type of user testing that is conducted by test feeding inputs into or performing operations of software to check for compliance with development requirements. This is non-code testing that will be performed primarily as part of an agile Scrum team.

Automation testing uses script automation to test code performance. Learning in this area may be performed as part of scrum team testing; but will be in conjunction with the QA automation team and may be done also outside of a Scrum team.

This position is part of an eight week internship program, consisting of 30 hour work weeks Monday-Friday. As a our QA intern, here are a few exciting things you can expect during your time with JAGGAER:

  • Working with staff QAs, youwill have responsibilities primarily of performing functional test of actual software on given environments, towards production, just as a regular staff QA. They will also learn and may begin over time to take on responsibilities of designing and implementing tests, and to debug and define corrective actions. You will also review system requirements and track quality assurance and outcome metric.
  • Reporting to a Product Owner and or Product Development Manager, you will learn about Agile and Scrum procedures, take part in various of its ceremonies and learn about the development life cycle process. The intern will also receive various assignments in support of these processes, in conducting documentation and technical writing, and otherwise assisting in the conduct of the team, as assigned.
  • Ultimately the successful candidate will be responsible for conducting tests before product launches to ensure software feature effectiveness, and that it meets requirements. Simultaneously you will learn the software development life cycle in a real development environment; while gaining experience in resolving system malfunctions to meet quality standards.

Principal Responsibilities

Awesome things you’ll do:

  • Review requirements, specifications and technical design documents to provide timely and meaningful feedback
  • Learn to create detailed, comprehensive and well-structured test plans and test cases
  • Will learn the use of industry standard Agile software to identify, record, document and track bugs
  • Perform regression testing when bugs are resolved
  • Learn new testing tools and test strategies
  • May have opportunity to develop and execute automation scripts using open source tools
  • Due to Covid-19 safety protocols, you will get to experience first-hand how software teams have shifted to working remotely yet maintaining collaboration and teamwork

Position Requirements

What you’ll bring:

  • Excitement for learning something new and being an important part of a small, focused team
  • 2+ years in a Business Information Systems or Computer Science degree seeking program 
  • Interest in becoming a software QA, BA, software designer or software developer
  • Demonstration of basic knowledge of the software development life cycle
  • Knowledge of basic code writing principles
  • Basic knowledge of HTML, SQL and scripting
  • Willing to learn Agile Scrum development process and QA testing techniques

JAGGAER offers equal employment opportunities without regard to race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, genetic information, veteran or military status and other protected class characteristics.
